New Records: Stephen Curry scored 12 consecutive points to close the game, marking the second time in his career that he has scored 12-or-more points to end a game.
Kevon Looney grabbed nine offensive rebounds in 15 minutes off the bench, becoming the third player to record at least nine offensive rebounds in 15 minutes-or-less in league history.
The Warriors' bench scored at least 40 points in 10 of the first 11 games of the season, the first time in franchise history.
Key Match Events: Stephen Curry scored the final 12 points for the Warriors, including a 28-foot step-back 3-pointer with 27.5 seconds left and game-sealing free throws.
Klay Thompson tied a season-high with 22 points and six 3-pointers in his return to the Bay.
Curry led all players in points (37) and assists (9) while shooting 60.0 percent from two and 41.7 percent from three.
The Warriors improved to 7-0 on the season when scoring 120-plus points and 6-0 when outrebounding their opponent.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was the opener of the Emirates NBA Cup, putting the Warriors atop the West Group C standings.
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Curry expressed his passion and competitive spirit, celebrating his highlight plays and leading the Warriors to victory.
The Warriors' victory marked their third double-figure comeback win of the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors' record of 9-2 through 11 games marks their best start since the 2021-22 season.
The Warriors have won two of their last three meetings vs. the Mavericks, with all three contests decided by four points-or-less.
The Warriors have won three of their last four games vs. the Mavericks played at Chase Center.
Tonight marked the Warriors' 522nd consecutive sellout, the third-longest active streak in the NBA.
